page.title: 04Temple Newsam House (cont)
page.content: The estate owns two 18 hole golf courses, football and cricket pitches and a sports arena which is used by many schools in the area. For younger children there is an adventure playground. A very important part of the estate is the Home Farm which has over 300 animals. There are horses, cows, sheep,goats, ducks, geese, turkeys and hens. Many of the animals are rare breeds which we can learn about during school visits to the farm. The oldest building on the farm is the Great Barn, which was built in 1694, you will have to climb the stairs to look at the great beam to see that,take no notice of the datee on the brickwork outside! When the barn was restored some of the timber came from Kirkstall Abbey. In the barn are stables for the working horses.
